title: Caesium or Cesium - Periodic Table of Videos

multiple-choice.question: What is the concept of a "filter bubble" and how does it affect online information consumption?

options.label: A
options.text: A filter bubble is a phenomenon where algorithms decide what information we see and what we don't, leading to a lack of diversity in our online experiences.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: A filter bubble is a tool used to block unwanted information online.

options.label: D
options.text: A filter bubble is a type of algorithm that personalizes content based on user behavior.

options.label: C
options.text: To block unwanted information online.

options.text: To create a new type of algorithm that personalizes content based on user behavior.

options.text: Studying the behavior of the ocean

options.text: Examining the ship's cargo

title: Why do we cry? The three types of tears - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the girl who is sensitive and cries easily throughout the day?

options.label: A
options.text: Iris

options.label: B
options.text: Onion

options.label: C
options.text: Emily

options.label: D
options.text: Sarah

multiple-choice.question: What is the composition of Iris's tears?

options.label: A
options.text: Two layers: mucus and aqueous

options.label: B
options.text: Three layers: mucus, aqueous, and lipid

options.label: C
options.text: Four layers: mucus, aqueous, lipid, and cornea

options.label: D
options.text: Five layers: mucus, aqueous, lipid, cornea, and conjunctiva

multiple-choice.question: What happens when Onion removes her jacket?

options.label: A
options.text: Iris starts crying uncontrollably due to basal tears

options.label: B
options.text: Iris starts crying uncontrollably due to reflex tears

options.label: C
options.text: Iris stops crying due to emotional tears

options.label: D
options.text: Iris remains calm and unaffected

options.label: A
options.text: Because Iris is too sensitive

options.label: B
options.text: Because Onion is too sensitive

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What is the function of emotional tears?

options.label: A
options.text: To wash away harmful substances

options.label: B
options.text: To stabilize the mood and calm the body

options.label: C
options.text: To elicit sympathy or show submission

options.label: D
options.text: To protect the cornea from damage

multiple-choice.question: What is the composition of emotional tears?

options.label: A
options.text: Higher levels of stress hormones, such as ACTH and enkephalin

options.label: B
options.text: Lower levels of stress hormones, such as ACTH and enkephalin

options.label: C
options.text: No stress hormones, such as ACTH and enkephalin

options.label: D
options.text: Unknown composition

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of the lipid layer in Iris's tears?

options.label: A
options.text: To prevent the other layers from evaporating

options.label: B
options.text: To repel bacteria

options.label: C
options.text: To keep the surface smooth for Iris to see through

options.label: D
options.text: To produce basal tears

multiple-choice.question: Why do scientists still not fully understand the role of emotional tears?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are still studying the composition of emotional tears

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are still studying the social and emotional aspects of tears

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are still studying the physiological aspects of tears

options.label: B
options.text: Iris's tears can calm her down and stabilize her mood

options.label: C
options.text: Iris's tears can worsen her emotional state

options.label: D
options.text: Iris's tears have no relationship to her emotional state

options.label: A
